abstract: Retired journalist Takashi Uemura, criticized by rightists for writing about Korean women who were forced work in Japanese military brothels during World War II, receives contract renewal from Hokusei Gakuen University; institution had been considering cancelling Uemura's teaching contract but bowed to show of public support on his behalf.
lead_paragraph: The university had received threats of attacks because of articles that Takashi Uemura wrote about women forced to work in Japanese brothels during World War II.

headline.main: Japanese University Retains Ex-Journalist Facing Far Right’s Ire
headline.print_headline: Japan: University Retains Ex-Journalist Under Fire From Ultranationalists
